exam_questions.question:
You are developing a JPEG image-resizing API hosted on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE). Callers of the service will exist within the same GKE cluster. You want clients to be able to get the IP address of the service.
What should you do?

choices.A: Define a GKE Service. Clients should use the name of the A record in Cloud DNS to find the service's cluster IP address.
choices.B: Define a GKE Service. Clients should use the service name in the URL to connect to the service.
choices.C: Define a GKE Endpoint. Clients should get the endpoint name from the appropriate environment variable in the client container.
choices.D: Define a GKE Endpoint. Clients should get the endpoint name from Cloud DNS.

exam_questions.question:
You are using Cloud Build to build and test application source code stored in Cloud Source Repositories. The build process requires a build tool not available in the Cloud Build environment.
What should you do?

choices.A: Download the binary from the internet during the build process.
choices.B: Build a custom cloud builder image and reference the image in your build steps.
choices.C: Include the binary in your Cloud Source Repositories repository and reference it in your build scripts.
choices.D: Ask to have the binary added to the Cloud Build environment by filing a feature request against the Cloud Build public Issue Tracker.

exam_questions.question:
You need to copy directory local-scripts and all of its contents from your local workstation to a Compute Engine virtual machine instance.
Which command should you use?

choices.A: gsutil cp --project "my-gcp-project" -r ~/local-scripts/ gcp-instance-name:~/server-scripts/ --zone "us-east1-b"
choices.B: gsutil cp --project "my-gcp-project" -R ~/local-scripts/ gcp-instance-name:~/server-scripts/ --zone "us-east1-b"
choices.C: gcloud compute scp --project "my-gcp-project" --recurse ~/local-scripts/ gcp-instance-name:~/server-scripts/ --zone "us-east1-b"
choices.D: gcloud compute mv --project "my-gcp-project" --recurse ~/local-scripts/ gcp-instance-name:~/server-scripts/ --zone "us-east1-b"

exam_questions.question:
You are deploying your application to a Compute Engine virtual machine instance with the Stackdriver Monitoring Agent installed. Your application is a unix process on the instance. You want to be alerted if the unix process has not run for at least 5 minutes. You are not able to change the application to generate metrics or logs.
Which alert condition should you configure?

choices.A: Uptime check
choices.B: Process health
choices.C: Metric absence
choices.D: Metric threshold

exam_questions.question:
You have two tables in an ANSI-SQL compliant database with identical columns that you need to quickly combine into a single table, removing duplicate rows from the result set.
What should you do?

choices.A: Use the JOIN operator in SQL to combine the tables.
choices.B: Use nested WITH statements to combine the tables.
choices.C: Use the UNION operator in SQL to combine the tables.
choices.D: Use the UNION ALL operator in SQL to combine the tables.

exam_questions.question:
You have an application deployed in production. When a new version is deployed, some issues don't arise until the application receives traffic from users in production. You want to reduce both the impact and the number of users affected.
Which deployment strategy should you use?

choices.A: Blue/green deployment
choices.B: Canary deployment
choices.C: Rolling deployment
choices.D: Recreate deployment

exam_questions.question:
Your company wants to expand their users outside the United States for their popular application. The company wants to ensure 99.999% availability of the database for their application and also wants to minimize the read latency for their users across the globe.
Which two actions should they take? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Create a multi-regional Cloud Spanner instance with "nam-asia-eur1" configuration.
choices.B: Create a multi-regional Cloud Spanner instance with "nam3" configuration.
choices.C: Create a cluster with at least 3 Spanner nodes.
choices.D: Create a cluster with at least 1 Spanner node.
choices.E: Create a minimum of two Cloud Spanner instances in separate regions with at least one node.
choices.F: Create a Cloud Dataflow pipeline to replicate data across different databases.

exam_questions.question:
You want to upload files from an on-premises virtual machine to Google Cloud Storage as part of a data migration. These files will be consumed by Cloud DataProc Hadoop cluster in a GCP environment.
Which command should you use?

choices.A: gsutil cp [LOCAL_OBJECT] gs://[DESTINATION_BUCKET_NAME]/
choices.B: gcloud cp [LOCAL_OBJECT] gs://[DESTINATION_BUCKET_NAME]/
choices.C: hadoop fs cp [LOCAL_OBJECT] gs://[DESTINATION_BUCKET_NAME]/
choices.D: gcloud dataproc cp [LOCAL_OBJECT] gs://[DESTINATION_BUCKET_NAME]/

exam_questions.question:
You migrated your applications to Google Cloud Platform and kept your existing monitoring platform. You now find that your notification system is too slow for time critical problems.
What should you do?

choices.A: Replace your entire monitoring platform with Stackdriver.
choices.B: Install the Stackdriver agents on your Compute Engine instances.
choices.C: Use Stackdriver to capture and alert on logs, then ship them to your existing platform.
choices.D: Migrate some traffic back to your old platform and perform AB testing on the two platforms concurrently.

exam_questions.question:
You have deployed an HTTP(s) Load Balancer with the gcloud commands shown below.<codeblock>
export NAME=load-balancer

# Create network
gcloud compute networks create ${NAME}

# Add instance
gcloud compute instances create ${NAME}-backend-instance-1

# Create the instance group
gcloud compute instance-groups unmanaged create ${NAME}-i --subnet ${NAME} --no-address

gcloud compute instance-groups unmanaged set-named-ports ${NAME}-i --named-ports http:80

gcloud compute instance-groups unmanaged add-instances ${NAME}-i --instances ${NAME}-backend-instance-1

# Configure health checks
gcloud compute health-checks create http ${NAME}-http-hc --port 80

# Create backend service
gcloud compute backend-services create ${NAME}-http-bes --health-checks ${NAME}-http-hc --protocol HTTP --port-name http --global

gcloud compute backend-services add-backend ${NAME}-http-bes --instance-group ${NAME}-i --balancing-mode RATE --max-rate 100000 --capacity-scaler 1.0 --global --instance-group-zone us-east1-d

# Create URLs maps and forwarding rule
gcloud compute url-maps create ${NAME}-http-urlmap --default-service ${NAME}-http-bes

gcloud compute target-http-proxies create ${NAME}-http-proxy --url-map ${NAME}-http-urlmap

gcloud compute forwarding-rules create ${NAME}-http-fw --global --target-http-proxy ${NAME}-http-proxy --ports 80

 </codeblock>Health checks to port 80 on the Compute Engine virtual machine instance are failing and no traffic is sent to your instances. You want to resolve the problem.
Which commands should you run?

choices.A: gcloud compute instances add-access-config ${NAME}-backend-instance-1
choices.B: gcloud compute instances add-tags ${NAME}-backend-instance-1 --tags http-server
choices.C: gcloud compute firewall-rules create allow-lb --network load-balancer --allow tcp:80 --source-ranges 130.211.0.0/22,35.191.0.0/16 --direction INGRESS
choices.D: gcloud compute firewall-rules create allow-lb --network load-balancer --allow tcp:80 --destination-ranges 130.211.0.0/22,35.191.0.0/16 --direction EGRESS

exam_questions.question:
Your website is deployed on Compute Engine. Your marketing team wants to test conversion rates between 3 different website designs.
Which approach should you use?

choices.A: Deploy the website on App Engine and use traffic splitting.
choices.B: Deploy the website on App Engine as three separate services.
choices.C: Deploy the website on Cloud Functions and use traffic splitting.
choices.D: Deploy the website on Cloud Functions as three separate functions.

exam_questions.question:
You are designing a schema for a table that will be moved from MySQL to Cloud Bigtable. The MySQL table is as follows:<codeblock>
CREATE TABLE AccountActivity (
    Account_id int,
    Event_timestamp datetime,
    Transaction_type varchar(255),
    Amount numeric(18, 4),
    PRIMARY KEY (Account_id, Event_timestamp)
);</codeblock>
How should you design a row key for Cloud Bigtable for this table?

choices.A: Set Account_id as a key.
choices.B: Set Account_id_Event_timestamp as a key.
choices.C: Set Event_timestamp_Account_id as a key.
choices.D: Set Event_timestamp as a key.

exam_questions.question:
You have an analytics application that runs hundreds of queries on BigQuery every few minutes using BigQuery API. You want to find out how much time these queries take to execute.
What should you do?

choices.A: Use Stackdriver Monitoring to plot slot usage.
choices.B: Use Stackdriver Trace to plot API execution time.
choices.C: Use Stackdriver Trace to plot query execution time.
choices.D: Use Stackdriver Monitoring to plot query execution times.
